definition: to stuff one's pockets/to take bribes
to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)

sentences.english: Yet poor Nigerians fear that corrupt officials will pocket the savings.
sentences.chinese: 可憐的尼日利亞人害怕腐敗官員會中飽私囊。

sentences.english: They all pocket each 50 cents as windfall.
sentences.chinese: 他們都將每個50美分中飽私囊，當作意外之財。

sentences.english: The policeman lined his pockets with bribes.
sentences.chinese: 這警察接受賄賂中飽私囊。

sentences.english: They are always trying to feather their nest.
sentences.chinese: 他們總是想盡辦法中飽私囊。

definition: lit. helping tyrant Zhou 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2] in his oppression (idiom)/fig. to take the side of the evildoer/giving succor to the enemy
to accumulate/to gather/to amass wealth by heavy taxation or other unscrupulous means/(science) convergent
to involve others (in a crime)/guilt by association
to break the law and commit crimes (idiom); malefactor/evildoer/to perpetrate outrages
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
to break the law and violate discipline (idiom)
(of an official) corrupt and negligent of his duty
lit. a horse that brings trouble to its herd (idiom)/fig. troublemaker/black sheep/rotten apple
